ground_truth: He holds her for another moment, then pulls away and glances at her. He forces a faint smile. Elise gives him a tender look. He turns away, and she watches him with concerned eyes. As he trudges out of the emergency room, a discouraged expression crosses her face. Exiting the ER, David walks down a corridor, his pained eyes staring straight ahead. A view from behind shows his lone form filing down the long hospital hallway. Now in a vast hallway lined with marble, Richardson joins Harry at a window overlooking New York City. Harry's gaze stays trained ahead. Meanwhile, Elise sits alone in the hospital waiting room. She blinks back tears, then shakes her head. Now a friend pushes Elise in a wheelchair. They head out. Harry gives him a skeptical look. Richardson puts on his fedora, gives Harry a pat on the arm, and walks off, leaving the younger officer alone at the window of the mid-century high-rise. Eleven months later, now on a sunny farm, David walks a green pasture. Later, in front of a barn and silos, he addresses a crowd. Sitting in a campaign bus, Charlie and an aide watch a news report on the vehicle's TV. Charlie heads outside. As David greets his supporters, the campaign chairman sits on a picnic table and reads a newspaper. He browses a page, folds it up, and frowns thoughtfully to himself. As voters disperse, David joins him. Charlie holds out the newspaper. An arts section feature shows photos of Elise, one dancing, the other with a bow. David stares at the photo, his brow cinched. As he leaves, Charlie gazes after him with pursed lips. Seated outside a waterfront warehouse, he wears a sober frown. Now under a dusky sky, David walks across a deserted shipping dock. He carelessly tracks his feet through a large glassy puddle and stops at the dock's edge, gazing toward the low sun. In her apartment, Elise sits at the foot of her bed, eyeing a document. She sets it aside, then lifts her troubled gaze. Now David approaches the ragged bar. As David disappears inside, Harry emerges from a neighboring door. Inside, David sits forlornly at the bar. The bartender hands him a slip of paper. David stares after her, then reads the note. At dusk, under pouring rain, he holds his jacket over his head as he runs along a dock to a warehouse. In the evening, he leans on the wall, waiting. Harry arrives in a fedora and trench coat, sheltered from the rain by an umbrella. He joins David. Harry lowers his gaze and takes a deep breath. He gives a grave shake of the head, then takes a seat on a stack of shipping pallets.

David, alone in a long hospital corridor, appears pained. In a marble hall, Richardson joins Harry at a window overlooking New York City, while Elise sits in the waiting room, blinking back tears. A friend wheels Elise out. Harry skeptically observes Richardson, who pats Harry's arm before leaving him alone. Eleven months later, on a sunny farm, David speaks to a crowd. As David greets supporters, the campaign chair reads a newspaper at a picnic table, then offers it to David, showing photos of Elise. David is troubled by the image. Charlie watches David leave, wearing a sober frown. At dusk on a deserted dock, David walks through a puddle, stopping to gaze at the sun. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He holds her close for another fleeting moment, then gently pulls away and glances at her with a mixture of emotions. Struggling to muster a semblance of positivity, he forces a faint smile to appear on his lips. Elise responds with a tender and understanding look in her eyes. As he turns his back on her, she watches him with eyes filled with deep concern. He trudges out of the emergency room, the weight of the world visible on his shoulders, and a discouraged expression briefly crosses her face as she watches him go. Once he is outside the ER, David walks down a corridor, his eyes filled with pain, staring intently straight ahead. From behind, the view captures his solitary form as he files down the long, echoing hospital hallway. In a vast expanse lined with gleaming marble, Richardson joins Harry at a window, which offers a breathtaking view overlooking New York City. Harry's unwavering gaze remains fixed straight ahead. Meanwhile, Elise finds herself sitting alone in the quiet hospital waiting room. Blinking back tears, she shakes her head in an attempt to compose herself. A friend soon arrives and assists by pushing Elise along in a wheelchair, and together they head out. Harry gives him a skeptical look as Richardson places his fedora neatly atop his head, gives Harry a reassuring pat on the arm, and walks away, leaving the younger officer alone at the window of the imposing mid-century high-rise. Eleven months later, in a striking contrast to the previous scene, now under the bright expanse of a sunny farm, David walks across a verdant green pasture. Later, positioned in front of a rustic barn and towering silos, he addresses a gathered crowd. Seated inside a bustling campaign bus, Charlie and an aide are engrossed in watching a news report on the vehicle's small TV screen. Charlie soon heads outside to join the activity. As David warmly greets his enthusiastic supporters, the campaign chairman sits nearby on a sturdy picnic table, engrossed in reading a newspaper. He casually browses through a page, then folds it up with a thoughtful frown etched on his face. As the crowd of voters begins to disperse, David joins him, and Charlie offers the newspaper to David. A feature in the arts section prominently displays photos of Elise, one capturing her in the grace of dance and the other with a poised bow. David stares intently at the photo, his brow furrowing in deep thought. As he makes his departure, Charlie gazes after him with pursed lips, contemplating the implications. Seated outside a waterfront warehouse, he wears a somber expression, the weight of recent events clearly visible. Now, under a sky tinged with the colors of dusk, David walks across an empty shipping dock. He carelessly drags his feet through a large, glassy puddle, creating ripples as he stops at the very edge of the dock, gazing toward the setting sun. In the solitude of her apartment, Elise sits at the foot of her bed, scrutinizing a document. She sets it aside, lifting her troubled gaze toward the unknown future. Now, David approaches the ragged bar with a heavy heart. As David disappears inside, Harry emerges from a neighboring door, his presence marked by a careful watchfulness. Inside the dimly lit bar, David sits forlornly, lost in thought. The bartender hands him a small slip of paper, a mysterious communication that captures his attention. David stares after her for a moment, then turns his focus to the note and begins to read. At dusk, under a relentless downpour, he holds his jacket desperately over his head as he runs along a dock towards a warehouse. Later in the evening, he leans wearily on the wall, waiting in anticipation. Harry arrives clad in a fedora and trench coat, effectively sheltered from the rain by a sturdy umbrella. He joins David and lowers his gaze, taking a deep, fortifying breath. With a grave shake of his head, he takes a seat on a stack of shipping pallets, signifying the weight of the news he bears.

Blinking back her tears, she shakes her head gently in an earnest attempt to compose herself. A supportive friend soon arrives and kindly assists by pushing Elise along in a wheelchair, and together they make their way out. Eleven months later, in a striking contrast to the previous somber scene, now under the bright, wide expanse of a sunny farm, David walks steadily across a verdant and lush green pasture. As David warmly greets his enthusiastic supporters, the campaign chairman sits nearby on a sturdy picnic table, engrossed in reading a newspaper. As the crowd of eager voters begins to gradually disperse, David joins him, and Charlie thoughtfully offers the newspaper to David. David stares intently at the photo, his brow furrowing in deep, contemplative thought. In the solitude of her apartment, Elise sits quietly at the foot of her bed, scrutinizing a document with intense focus. She sets it aside gently, lifting her troubled gaze toward the yet-unknown future. Now, David approaches the ragged, weather-worn bar with a heavy heart. As David disappears inside, Harry emerges from a neighboring door, his presence marked by a careful, watchful vigilance. Inside the dimly lit and somewhat somber bar, David sits forlornly, lost deeply in his thoughts. The bartender approaches and hands him a small slip of paper, a mysterious communication that immediately captures his attention. David stares after her for a contemplative moment, then turns his focus to the note and begins to read. At dusk, under a relentless and pouring downpour, he desperately holds his jacket over his head as he runs along a dock towards a looming warehouse. Later in the evening, he leans wearily against the wall, waiting with a sense of anticipation. Harry arrives, clad in a fedora and trench coat, effectively sheltered from the rain by a sturdy umbrella. He joins David, lowering his gaze as he takes a deep, fortifying breath. With a grave and consequential shake of his head, he takes a seat on a stack of weathered shipping pallets, signifying the heaviness of the news he bears.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He holds her for another moment, feeling the warmth and comfort of the embrace, then slowly pulls away, creating a small distance between them, and glances at her face to catch her expression. He forces a faint smile, attempting to convey reassurance despite the emotional weight in his eyes. Elise returns his gaze with a tender look, her eyes soft with empathy and understanding. Turning away from her, he takes a step back, and she watches him leave, her eyes filled with concern and unease. As he begins to trudge out of the emergency room, his feet dragging heavily on the linoleum floor, a discouraged expression flits across her face, reflecting her inner turmoil. Exiting the ER, David walks down a corridor, his pained eyes staring straight ahead, seemingly unaware of his surroundings. The camera captures a view from behind, emphasizing his solitary figure as he makes his way down the long hospital hallway. Transitioning into a vast hallway lined with marble, Richardson joins Harry at a large window that offers an expansive view of New York City. Harry’s gaze remains fixed straight ahead, seemingly lost in thought. Meanwhile, Elise sits alone in the hospital waiting room, her posture slumped with exhaustion. She blinks back tears that threaten to spill over, then shakes her head slightly as if to shake off despair. A friend approaches and gently pushes Elise in a wheelchair, guiding her through the bustling hospital environment as they head out. Harry casts a skeptical look in Richardson's direction. Richardson, with a casual air, places his fedora on his head, pats Harry encouragingly on the arm, and walks off, leaving the younger officer to contemplate alone at the window of the mid-century high-rise. Eleven months later, set against the backdrop of a sunny farm, David walks through a lush green pasture, his steps deliberate and reflective. Later, standing in front of a rustic barn and towering silos, he addresses a crowd, his voice carrying over the open space as he engages with his audience. Inside a campaign bus, Charlie and an aide intently watch a news report playing on the vehicle’s TV, analyzing the unfolding events. Charlie, feeling compelled, heads outside to join the fray. As David energetically greets his supporters, the campaign chairman perches on a picnic table, engrossed in a newspaper. He carefully browses the page, his eyes scanning for information, then folds it up with precision, a thoughtful frown playing on his lips as he contemplates its contents. As the voters begin to disperse, David strides over to join the chairman, who holds out the newspaper with a sense of urgency. An arts section feature captures David’s attention, displaying photos of Elise, one dynamic image of her dancing and another poised with a bow. David stares at the photos, his brow knit in concentration and introspection. As he turns to leave, Charlie watches him go, his lips pursed in contemplation. Seated outside a waterfront warehouse, David wears a sober frown, lost in thought. Under a dusky sky, he walks across a deserted shipping dock, his steps echoing in the silence. Carelessly, he tracks his feet through a large glassy puddle, the water rippling in his wake, before stopping at the dock’s edge to gaze into the low sun, contemplating the horizon. In her apartment, Elise sits at the foot of her bed, her eyes scanning a document. She sets it aside with a resigned gesture, lifting her troubled gaze to the empty room. David approaches a ragged bar, his steps purposeful yet hesitant. As David disappears inside, Harry emerges from a neighboring door, taking in the scene with a discerning eye. Inside, David sits forlornly at the bar, absorbed in his thoughts. The bartender approaches and hands him a slip of paper, a silent exchange that holds untold significance. David stares after the bartender, then shifts his focus to the note, reading its contents with intent. At dusk, under a sky heavy with pouring rain, he holds his jacket over his head, trying to shield himself as he runs along a dock towards a dimly lit warehouse. In the evening, he leans against the wall, waiting patiently and feeling the passage of time. Harry arrives, his silhouette framed by a fedora and trench coat, sheltered from the rain by an umbrella. He steps up to join David, lowering his gaze and taking a deep, reflective breath. A grave shake of the head follows, communicating unspoken words and emotions, before he takes a seat on a stack of shipping pallets, settling into a contemplative silence beside David.

As David greets his supporters the campaign chairman sits on a picnic table and reads a newspaper. He browses a page folds it up and frowns thoughtfully to himself. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. As voters disperse David joins him. Charlie holds out the newspaper. An arts section feature shows photos of Elise one dancing the other with a bow. David stares at the photo his brow cinched. As he leaves Charlie gazes after him with pursed lips. Seated outside a waterfront warehouse he wears a sober frown. Now under a dusky sky. David walks across a deserted shipping dock. He carelessly tracks his feet through a large glassy puddle and stops at the dock's edge gazing toward the low sun. In her apartment Elise sits at the foot of her bed eyeing a document. She sets it aside then lifts her troubled gaze. Now David approaches the ragged bar. As David disappears inside Harry emerges from a neighboring door. Inside David sits forlornly at the bar. The bartender hands him a slip of paper. David stares after her then reads the note. At dusk under pouring rain he holds his jacket over his head as he runs along a dock to a warehouse. In the evening he leans on the wall waiting. Harry arrives in a fedora and trench coat sheltered from the rain by an umbrella. He joins David. Harry lowers his gaze and takes a deep breath. He gives a grave shake of the head then takes a seat on a stack of shipping pallets.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He holds her for another moment then pulls away and glances at her. He forces a faint smile. Elise gives him a tender look. He turns away and she watches him with concerned eyes. As he trudges out of the emergency room a discouraged expression crosses her face. Exiting the ER. David walks down a corridor his pained eyes staring straight ahead. A view from behind shows his lone form filing down the long hospital hallway. Now in a vast hallway lined with marble Richardson joins Harry at a window overlooking New York City. Harry's gaze stays trained ahead. Meanwhile Elise sits alone in the hospital waiting room. She blinks back tears then shakes her head. Now a friend pushes Elise in a wheelchair. They head out. Harry gives him a skeptical look. Richardson puts on his fedora gives Harry a pat on the arm and walks off leaving the younger officer alone at the window of the midcentury highrise. Eleven months later now on a sunny farm David walks a green pasture. Later in front of a barn and silos he addresses a crowd. Sitting in a campaign bus Charlie and an aide watch a news report on the vehicle's TV. Charlie heads outside. As David greets his supporters the campaign chairman sits on a picnic table and reads a newspaper. He browses a page folds it up and frowns thoughtfully to himself. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The eagle perches near the cactus for another moment, then leaps away and flutters at the cactus. The eagle flashes a faint frown. Joanna sends the eagle a boisterous smirk. The eagle pivots away, and the cactus examines the eagle with amused lenses. As the eagle tiptoes out of the bakery, a cheerful feeling crosses the cactus's face. Departing the bakery, Thomas floats through a corridor, his happy lenses studying leftward. A view from above shows his paired form floating down the short meadow walkway. Now in a petite room lined with feathers, Anderson confronts Lucy at a window overlooking Las Vegas. Lucy's stare remains tilting backward. Meanwhile, Joanna lounges with bears in the park watching space. She yawns gently, then taps her toes. Now a companion swings Joanna in a hammock. They wander in. Lucy sends the eagle a proud frown. Anderson removes his helmet, gives Lucy a tap on the shoulder, and drifts off, leaving the older gardener with flowers at the edge of the old-century dormitory. Eighteen days earlier, now on a snowy mountain, Thomas flies a dark canyon. Later, behind a forest and hills, he addresses a parade. Standing on a cruise ship, Betty and a chef read an advertisement in the vessel’s brochure. Betty wanders below deck. As Thomas greets his bakers, the fashion designer stands on a swing set and sketches a recipe. He marks a line, crumples it up, and grins joyfully to himself. As artists gather, Thomas faces him. Betty holds out the recipe. A puzzle book entry sketches maps of Joanna, one diving, the other with a pen. Thomas glances at the sketch, his lips open. As he vanishes, Betty stares after him with wide eyes. Sitting inside a mountain cave, she wears a vibrant grin. Now under a starry horizon, Thomas floats through a populated wheat field. He cautiously carries his wings through a tiny swirling whirlwind and lands at the corner's ridge, soaring over the tall clouds. In his studio, Joanna lounges at the edge of a sofa, squinting at a postcard. She tosses it aside, then drops her curious stare. Now Thomas approaches the crimson gate. As Thomas slips outside, Lucy appears from a distant tent. Inside, Thomas lounges merrily on the ledge. The driver hands him a piece of wood. Thomas glances after them, then studies the carving. At dawn, under gentle snow, he drapes his scarf over his arms as he strolls along a path to a library. In the morning, he kneels on the floor, pondering. Lucy arrives in a helmet and raincoat, shielded from the snow by a parasol. She faces Thomas. Lucy lifts her smile and exhales a deep laugh. She gives a bright nod of the ears, then rises to a stage of gym mats.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: David and Elise share a tender moment in the hospital before he leaves with a pained expression. Alone, Elise struggles with her emotions. Meanwhile, David appears eleven months later on a farm, speaking to a crowd during a campaign. As he reviews a newspaper with his campaign chairman Charlie, he is struck by a photo of Elise in the arts section, prompting introspection. Later, David walks across a deserted dock under a dusky sky. Elise, in her apartment, contemplates a document with a troubled expression. David visits a bar and receives a note, which he reads before running through the rain to a warehouse at dusk. There, he waits until Harry arrives, and the two share a silent, grave exchange, with Harry shaking his head before sitting on a stack of pallets.
